title: PHIGALIA
content:
PHIGALIA was the Dryad-nymph eponym of the town of Phigalia in Arkadia (southern Greece).

PHIGA′LIA (Phigalia), a Dryad, from whom the town of Phigalia was believed to have derived its name.
        (Paus. viii. 39. § 2; Strab. viii. p. 348.)

Source: Dictionary of Greek and Roman Biography and Mythology.

Pausanias, Description of Greece 8. 39. 3 (trans. Jones) (Greek travelogue C2nd A.D.)
          :
        "Others have said that Phigalia [eponym of the Arkadian town of Phigalia] was one of the Nymphai (Nymphs)
        called Dryades."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
